author: Sam Sacks
title: Fiction Chronicle: A Sunny Place for Shady People
text: Paul Goldberg’s novel “The Château” (Picador, 376 pages, $26) concerns the criminal underbelly of a South Florida retirement community, a premise so superbly batty that it’s hard to believe it hasn’t already been claimed by the slicks at HBO or Showtime. Its standout character is Melsor Yakovlevich Katzenelenbogen, what you get if you “cross American fraud with Russian literature.” Melsor is running for the board of directors of his condominium, the Château Sedan Neuve, in order to get his hands on the kickbacks from contracting boondoggles, and the upcoming election has put him in ruthless competition with a rogue’s...
